H0.text: Repairing the double strand of DNA is an important function of nucleases.

H1.text: Concentrating RNA into a nucleolus is an important function of nucleases.

H2.text: Maintaining homeostasis of nucleoplasm is an important function of nucleases.

H3.text: Dissolving the nuclear membrane during mitosis is an important function of nucleases.

A4.text: Enzymes called AP endonucleases nick the damaged DNA backbone at the AP site.

A5.text: First the damage is recognized, then 12-24 nucleotide-long strands of DNA are removed both upstream and downstream of the damage site by endonucleases, and the removed DNA region is then resynthesized.
